channel.title: Latest Cricket News Today, Live Cricket Score, Match Coverage, ICC Cricket News | Hindustan Times
channel.description: Get all the Latest Cricket News, Live Cricket Score, Match Coverage, Match Analysis, Match Highlights, ICC Cricket Team, Cricket Tournaments and more on Hindustan Times.
channel.copyright: Copyright (C) 2019 HT Media Limited. All Rights Reserved.

image.title: Latest Cricket News Today, Live Cricket Score, Match Coverage, ICC Cricket News | Hindustan Times

item.title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy: Greg Chappell says 'India are more vulnerable at home' against Australia. Here's why
item.description: Australia are looking to record their first Test series win in India since 2005.

item.title: 'Usko bhi log sunte hain?': PAK pacer's reply as anchor shockingly calls Gautam Gambhir '4 feet - Rajpal Yadav ka bhai'
item.description: During an interview with veteran Pakistan pacer, in a rather shocking manner, the anchor mocked former India cricketer Gautam Gambhir, calling him, "4 feet - Rajpal Yadav ka bhai" and the Pakistan pacer responded to it.

item.title: Bowling in the IPL is always a good challenge: Imran Tahir
item.description: On his experiences of playing in Indian conditions, Tahir said it is the passion for the sport in the country that a cricketer doesn’t need much exposure to shine in the country.

item.title: Virender Sehwag's savage reply after fan says 'New Zealand se darr lagta hai' leaves Twitter in splits
item.description: The former India opener had a hilarious response to the fan's ‘New Zealand’ comment on Twitter.

item.title: Suryakumar Yadav hints at Test debut in India vs Australia Border-Gavaskar Trophy opener in Nagpur
item.description: Will we see Suryakumar Yadav make the transition from India blues to whites? His latest message could be a huge hint.

item.title: 'I said this when he made his T20I debut...': Rashid Latif names 23-year-old in surprising pick for Indian Test team
item.description: The youngster is an integral part of the Indian T20I side but is yet to receive a call-up for the longest format.

item.title: 'Cheap copy': Cricket Pakistan's 'New Mr. 360' post for Babar Azam batting video irks Suryakumar Yadav fans - Watch
item.description: Cricket Pakistan's official handle shared a video of Babar batting in the nets playing certain unorthodox shot, with the caption 'Babar Azam, the new Mr 360'. In the video, Babar could be seen playing a few scoops over fine leg and a few more, but it was enough to irk users, especially fans of SKY.

item.title: 'Unki aadat hai. Pitch samajh naa aaye toh unfair ho jaati hai': Ex-Pakistan captain tears into Ian Healy
item.description: The former Pakistan captain bashed Ian Healy for his controversial remarks on Indian pitches ahead of the first Test in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

item.title: 'There was a Rohit camp and a Virat camp. Ravi called them both and said...': How Shastri reacted to Kohli vs Rohit saga
item.description: Although through no fault of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, the advent of social media and reports of a tiff had reportedly strained their relationship, albeit slightly. Things went down between the two but before it could reach a crescendo, Ravi Shastri was around to control the situation.

item.title: '... Harbhajan would've bowled last over': India's 2007 T20 WC winner reveals Dhoni's 'miscalculation' in final vs PAK
item.description: MS Dhoni led India to inaugural T20 World Cup victory in 2007 but a member of the winning squad has now made a revelation about the final overs of the match against Pakistan.

item.title: ‘He can be an alarm bell against Steve Smith’: Pathan sends big message for Rohit and co. on 'threatening' India bowler
item.description: Former India pacer Irfan Pathan zeroed in one bowler who he thought could trouble Smith. He also provided reasons to back his opinion.

item.title: 'Not complaining or giving excuses. It's the truth': India star breaks silence with emotional rant after being dropped
item.description: The Team India star lost his place in the side in October last year, and has since put consistent performances in the Ranji Trophy.

item.title: 'It's what makes Test cricket great': Legendary India coach's mouth-shutting reply to Healy's 'unfair' pitch remark
item.description: Ian Healy took a massive dig at BCCI pertaining to pitches while making his prediction for the contest between India and Australia. In response, legendary India coach gave a mouth-shutting reply to the former cricketer.

item.title: 'He's the backbone of this batting order': Ashwin snubs Kohli, Rohit to name 'India's crucial player in Pant’s absence'
item.description: R Ashwin feels that India do have the perfect player to step up in Pant's absence as he snubbed both Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in naming the "backbone" of India's batting order.

item.title: 'Umran Malik jaise hamaare domestic cricket mein bhare pade hain': Pakistan pacer targets India speedster in fiery jibe
item.description: Pakistan pacer Sohail Khan has come up with yet another bizarre take, this time on India pacer Umran Malik, saying that although the 23-year-old is a promising talent, 'bowlers like him' are very common in Pakistan's domestic cricket structure.

item.title: MFA League: Shaikh, Patil net brace in Atlanta FC win
item.description: In another match, Bombay Muslims SC defeated Mumbai Strikers SC 2-0, with striker Akeef Momin finding a goal in each half to complete the win.

item.title: Jay Shah to attend ACC meet to decide on Pakistan's Asia Cup hosting rights, BCCI's stand to remain unchanged: Report
item.description: If sources in the BCCI are to be believed, there is little to no chance of the Asia Cup being held in Pakistan in September.

item.title: Are warm-up games becoming history?
item.description: With the trend of curated net sessions becoming common, the romance of tour matches, which were an event before the big event, is fading away

item.title: Shaheen Afridi marries Shahid Afridi's daughter; Babar Azam, Naseem Shah among attendees. See pics
item.description: Shaheen Afridi has tied the knot with former captain Shahid Afridi's daughter in Karachi, thus becoming the third Pakistan cricket star to get married this year.

item.title: Ranji Trophy: MP set up semi-final clash with Bengal; Karnataka register innings win over Uttarakhand in quarters
item.description: MP will take on Bengal in the semifinals from February 8 in a repeat of last edition's last-four stage match. MP had won that match by 174 runs at Alur, Karnataka.

item.title: Mohammed Siraj bares his heart to R Ashwin on becoming No.1 ODI bowler
item.description: On Friday, during India's practice session for the upcoming Test series, off spinner Ravichandran Ashwin posted two videos on Instagram, with teammate Siraj in which he has shared his feelings after achieving the No.1 ranking.

item.title: Ex-India coach's 'massive series' prediction for Rohit Sharma ahead of Border-Gavaskar Trophy
item.description: The upcoming home Test series against Australia marks the return of Rohit Sharma as India's captain in red-ball cricket.

item.title: 'There was nothing in it': Pakistan pacer's startling take on Virat Kohli's iconic straight six off Haris Rauf
item.description: In a startling take, Pakistan pacer Sohail Khan, who is making news for his infamous comment on Kohli, feels there was nothing special about the straight six that Virat played off Haris Rauf in the India vs Pakistan game at last year's T20 World Cup.

item.title: 'For legend like Kohli, he can't even have an average of 30 for 3 years': Pathan outlines Virat's 'embarrassing' stat
item.description: Ahead of the impending contest, that begins from February 9 onwards in Nagpur, former India cricketer Irfan Pathan has highlighted one of Kohli's most "embarrassing" stats, saying that the numbers will be on his mind when he faces Australia.

item.title: Holiday over, Virat Kohli and Co. ‘back at it’ as India gear up for Border-Gavaskar Trophy vs Australia
item.description: On Friday, BCCI shared pictures of Rohit, Kohli, Cheteshwar Pujara, KL Rahul, Ravindra Jadeja and other players, practising for the Nagpur Test.

item.title: Jos Buttler names Team India star as the 'fiercest bowler' he faced, picks Sanju Samson for unique batting skill
item.description: England's white-ball captain picked the Team India star when he was asked on the ‘fiercest bowler’ he had faced during his career so far.

item.title: 'Rishabh would've been 1st choice': Ex-India batter's verdict on who takes Pant's place as wicketkeeper in ODIs
item.description: KL Rahul currently looks to be the favourite to take Rishabh Pant's place as India's first choice wicketkeeper in the ODI squad.

item.title: Pujara was 8 off 61 when Ravi Shastri decided he had seen enough. He said, 'Stop riding a Luna and...': Ex-India coach
item.description: Former India fielding coach R Sridhar has narrated an incident when Cheteshwar Pujara's overcautious approach once played with the patience of Ravi Shastri so much that he was forced to send out a message for India's No. 3 in Tests.

item.title: 'It's Border-Gavaskar Trophy guys. So we need this...': Ashwin's epic reaction to Healy's 'unfair' pitch claim on India
item.description: Giving his prediction on Australia's chances in the impending four-Test series, Ian Healy took a sly dig at India for the pitches produced in the 2016.17 series, the last time it was played in the subcontinent. Ashwin has given an epic reaction on Healy's claim.

item.title: 'Can they bat here? Can they see off Ashwin, Jadeja?': Kaif hits back at Gilchrist with 'Australia are scared' remark
item.description: Former India star Mohammed Kaif spoke in detail about the Australian team ahead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, that begins on February 9.

item.title: 'Only one big innings in 6 months and then…’: Ex-India selector's scathing remark on Ishan Kishan
item.description: In no surprise, cricket fans and experts are up in arms against Ishan. In the absence of Rishabh Pant, he has been picked in to the squad as a wicketkeeper-batter alongside KS Bharat, for the Test series against Australia. But given his poor form, his selection in the playing XI looks in doldrums.

item.title: Dinesh Karthik makes huge prediction about Gill and Suryakumar for 1st Test vs Australia in Border Gavaskar Trophy
item.description: India cricketer Dinesh Karthik has backed Surykumar to play in the 1st Test against Australia in the upcoming Border-Gavaskar Trophy this month.

item.title: Watch: Shahid Afridi smashes would-be son-in-law Shaheen for six one day before wedding, Pakistan pacer's reply is gold
item.description: Shaheen Afridi, who is set to marry the daughter of former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi, received a welcome present from his would-be father-in-law.

item.title: 'Foreign coach ke saath ye sahi rehte hain. Angrez se darte hain': Ex-Pakistan coach's savage remark on Babar and co.
item.description: The former Pakistan coach who represented the side in 26 Tests spoke in detail about the need for a foreign coach in the team.

item.title: Watch: 'Duplicate' Ashwin helps Steve Smith and Co. prepare for India spinners ahead of Border-Gavaskar Trophy
item.description: Pithiya who hails from Junagadh in Saurashtra is locally quite famous for his bowling action which is similar to Ashwin's. He impersonates Ashwin's load-up, delivery stride and release and bowls with a similar wrist position as his idol.

item.title: India's 2007 T20 World Cup-winning pacer Joginder Sharma retires from all forms of cricket
item.description: Joginder Sharma represented India in 4 ODIs and 4 T20Is. He, however, never played for India after the T20 World Cup final.

item.title: 'They earn big money. But how long it can last?': Ian Botham bashes India in explosive 'Test cricket vs IPL' rant
item.description: Former England all-rounder Ian Botham made a rather controversial remark on the advent of the Indian Premier League.

item.title: 'India looked at Pakistan and designed their bowling attack the same way': Ramiz Raja makes bold claim
item.description: Pakistan's former captain Ramiz Raja made a big claim on Indian bowling attack after the side's emphatic 2-1 T20I series victory against New Zealand.

item.title: Dhoni told Kohli 'side ho ja, tu janta nahi isko': Pakistan pacer on heated exchange in India vs Pakistan 2015 WC match
item.description: There was an incident during an India-Pakistan match in the 2015 ODI World Cup at the Adelaide Oval in Australia when Dhoni had to step in. It was between then-India vice-captain Virat Kohli and Pakistan pacer Sohail Khan. In the latter's words, it was Kohli, who started the war of words.

item.title: 'Virat Kohli might be there, but Rohit definitely won't play': Ex-India opener makes massive prediction on star duo
item.description: The former India opener has made a big prediction on the star duo of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli after both missed India's T20I series against Sri Lanka and New Zealand this year.

item.title: Irfan Pathan gives no-nonsense verdict to settle 'Rahul vs Gill' debate ahead of Border-Gavaskar Trophy vs Australia
item.description: Despite being in the form of his life, Shubman Gill is heavily tipped to make way for KL Rahul, who is the designated opener of the Indian team in the longest format. India will meet Australia in the 1st Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2023 on Thursday.

item.title: ‘If Bumrah doesn’t want to play Test cricket…': Australia legend Jeff Thomson's message for India pacer
item.description: Jasprit Bumrah has ended up missing the Asia Cup and, more importantly, the T20 World Cup last year due to injuries.

item.title: Hardik Pandya drops huge update on Test future ahead of Border-Gavaskar Trophy vs Australia
item.description: Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya opened up about his return to Test cricket ahead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy between India and Australia.

item.title: 'I'm giving you 10 years in age. The least you can do is...': Virat Kohli's important lesson for Shubman Gill
item.description: The Shubman Gill-Virat Kohli connection is not new. It was under Kohli that Gill made his India debut back in 2019 during an ODI against New Zealand and it was Virat who interviewed Shubman after the 23-year-old hammered a breathtaking 208 last month in Hyderabad.

item.title: ‘Please don't have amnesia. His career was on the line...’: Karthik picks Kohli's ‘first choice’ replacement in T20Is
item.description: After being rested for the T20Is against Sri Lanka, senior pro Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma were once again not considered for the three-match series against New Zealand.

item.title: Route Mobile crowned B Division champions
item.description: Asif Shaikh's 5/86 bundled out Nirlon Sports Club for 297 as Route Mobile Ltd. won the Times Shield 'B' Division title by virtue of first innings lead at the MCA-BKC ground.

item.title: India find their T20 groove
item.description: The last few weeks might have marked a turning point in this team's evolution

item.title: Viacom 18 hopes to change the game with its free-IPL pitch
item.description: The Reliance-backed broadcaster says its target audience is not just those who can afford smart TV’s but anyone and everyone who has a smartphone.

item.title: 'Prithvi Shaw can probably...': Mohammad Kaif passes verdict on Hardik Pandya's captaincy after New Zealand series
item.description: Mohammad Kaif explained what role Hardik Pandya played as a captain in India's series win over New Zealand on Wednesday.

item.title: In the fitness of things
item.description: Skill is a pre-requisite in sports but in the current era, that may not be enough

item.title: 'He never looked back after that': Shubman Gill's former KKR captain recalls him 'craving for opening position'
item.description: Shubman Gill seems to have made the opening position his own in the Indian team in white ball cricket with extraordinary recent performances.

item.title: Watch: Wicketkeeper gets TV umpire to rectify decision after ‘embarrassing’ brain fade moment in BBL
item.description: What caught most eyes was an embarrassing brain fade moment involving the third umpire, which created a brief moment of confusion in the proceedings.

item.title: 'As much potential as Virat Kohli': Irfan Pathan's massive statement on India star after New Zealand series
item.description: Former Indian all-rounder Irfan Pathan was all praise for the Team India star as Hardik Pandya and Co. crushed New Zealand in the 3rd T20I to seal the series 2-1 on Wednesday.

item.title: 'That's how you bowl to greats like Richards and Gavaskar': Jeff Thomson's plan for Australia to silence Virat Kohli
item.description: Virat Kohli will be looking to get back to his best in Test cricket, as he has in the limited overs formats, when India face Australia in a much-anticipated series this month.

item.title: It's a slap on Pakistan cricket: Misbah blasts at PCB over Mickey Arthur situation, says ‘we disrespect our own people’
item.description: While talks between PCB and Mickey Arthur failed to make him the head coach, fresh development state that the ex-cricketer will come onboard as the new team director.

item.title: Keeping skills, work ethic behind Bharat's rise
item.description: Having been back-up to Rishabh Pant for the past year, the 29-year-old from Andhra is ready to grab his opportunity.

item.title: Watch: Hanuma Vihari uses bat like a sword, reverse sweeps, hits fours in another gritty innings despite fractured arm
item.description: During his gritty knock, even the opposition team lauded Vihari by giving a standing ovation. Commentators went on to compare his batting style while playing a reverse sweep to the swing of a sword. And a video of the same shot went viral on social media.

item.title: ‘He thought I’ve done well, let me relax but suddenly…’: Ex-chief selector miffed with India star's poor show
item.description: With all-rounders Axar Patel and Washington Sundar doing the job, it is now getting extremely difficult for Chahal to hold onto his spot in the XI. Former India left-arm spinner Sunil Joshi believes Chahal should request the team management to allow him to play first-class cricket.

item.title: Watch: Suryakumar Yadav awestruck upon watching his own replay on the big screen, expressions are magical
item.description: Impressed with his brilliant work on the field, Suryakumar Yadav was also awestruck upon watching his own replay on the big screen during the 3rd T20I between India and New Zealand at the Narendra Modi Stadium.
